name: Babies per woman
description: Total fertility rate. The number of children that would be born to each woman with prevailing age-specific fertility rates.

name: CO2 emissions
description: Carbon dioxide emissions from the burning of fossil fuels (metric tonnes of CO2 per person).

name: Income per person
description: Gross domestic product per person adjusted for differences in purchasing power (in international dollars, fixed 2005 prices, PPP based on 2005 ICP).

name: Child mortality rate
description: Death of children under five years of age per 1,000 live births

name: Life expectancy at birth (years)
description: The average number of years a newborn child would live if current mortality patterns were to stay the same.

name: Aid given
description: Total amount of allocable aid for official development assistance (ODA) given by the donor countries, expressed in constant 2007 US$.

name: Aid given per person
description: Total amount of official development assistance (ODA) aid that has been given during this year divided by the population of the country (2007 US$)

name: Aid given, % of GNI
description: Percentage of the gross national income (GNI) of each recepient country that has been given as official development assistance (ODA) aid during this year.

name: Water and sanitation aid given
description: Percentage of total allocable aid for official development assistance (ODA) given by the donor countries that has been used in water and sanitation.

name: Economical infrastructure aid given
description: Percentage of total allocable aid for official development assistance (ODA) given by the donor countries that has been used in economical infrastructures.

name: Production sector aid given
description: Percentage of total allocable aid for official development assistance (ODA) given by the donor countries that has been used in production sectors, including agriculture and industry, etc.

name: Multisector cross-cutting aid given
description: Percentage of total allocable aid for official development assistance (ODA) given by the donor countries that has been used in multisector cross-cutting.

name: Education aid given
description: Percentage of total allocable aid for official development assistance (ODA) given by the donor countries that has been used in education.

name: Health aid given
description: Percentage of total allocable aid for official development assistance (ODA) given by the donor countries that has been used in health.

name: Population policies aid given
description: Percentage of total allocable aid for official development assistance (ODA) given by the donor countries that has been used in population policies/programs and reproductive health.

name: Government and society aid given
description: Percentage of total allocable aid for official development assistance (ODA) given by the donor countries that has been used in government and civil societies.

name: Other social services aid given
description: Percentage of total allocable aid for official development assistance (ODA) given by the donor countries that has been used in other social infrastructures and services.

name: Aid received
description: The sum of aid each recepient country gets during this year from all donor countries in all sectors, expressed in fixed 2007 US$.

name: Aid received per person
description: The average amount of aid each person in the recepient country gets during this year from all donor countries in all sectors, expressed in current US$.

name: Aid received, % of GNI
description: Percentage of the gross national income (GNI) of each recepient country that comes from official development assistance (ODA) aid during this year.

name: Dollar billionaires per million
description: Number of billionaires among every 1 million people in the country of their citizenship, calculation based on data from Forbes.com

name: Average age of $ billionaires
description: The average age of billionaires in the country of their citizenship, calculation based on data from Forbes.com

name: Dollar billionaires
description: Total number of billionaires in the country of their citizenship, provided by Forbes.com

name: Debt to foreigners
description: External debt, total (% of GNI)

name: Total reserves
description: Total reserves (% of external debt)

name: Total GDP
description: Total GDP (constant exchange rate US$)

name: GDP/capita
description: GDP per capita in exchange rate terms and adjusted for inflation (2000 US$)

name: GDP/employee
description: The average Gross Domestic Products per each employee during the given year, counted by constant 1990 US$.

name: GDP/working hour
description: The average Gross Domestic Products per hour per person, counted by constant 1990 US$.

name: GDP/capita growth over next 10 years
description: Average growth in GDP per capita over the subsequent 10 years, i.e. the data for 1980 concerns the average growth 1980-90. The data is based on income per person v12. Projections after 2005.

name: GDP/capita growth
description: Annual growth in GDP pc. Based on World Bank data.

name: Total GNI
description: PPP GNI (formerly PPP GNP) is gross national income converted to international dollars using purchasing power parity rates. An international dollar has the same purchasing power over GNI as a U.S. dollar has in the United States.

name: GNI/capita
description: GNI per capita (constant 2000 US$)

name: GNI/capita (Atlas method)
description: GNI per capita, Atlas method (current US$)

name: GNI/capita PPP
description: GNI per capita, PPP (current international $)

name: Gini coefficient
description: Gini index measures the extent to which the distribution of income (or, in some cases, consumption expenditure) among individuals or households within an economy deviates from a perfectly equal distribution. A Lorenz curve plots the cumulative percentages of total income received against the cumulative number of recipients, starting with the poorest individual or household. The Gini index measures the area between the Lorenz curve and a hypothetical line of absolute equality, expressed as a percentage of the maximum area under the line. Thus a Gini index of 0 represents perfect equality, while an index of 100 implies perfect inequality.

name: Income of richest 10%
description: Percentage share of income or consumption is the share that accrues to subgroups of population indicated by deciles or quintiles. Percentage shares by quintile may not sum to 100 because of rounding.

name: Income of richest 20%
description: Percentage share of income or consumption is the share that accrues to subgroups of population indicated by deciles or quintiles. Percentage shares by quintile may not sum to 100 because of rounding.

name: Income of 2nd richest 20%
description: Percentage share of income or consumption is the share that accrues to subgroups of population indicated by deciles or quintiles. Percentage shares by quintile may not sum to 100 because of rounding.

name: Income of middle 20%
description: Percentage share of income or consumption is the share that accrues to subgroups of population indicated by deciles or quintiles. Percentage shares by quintile may not sum to 100 because of rounding.

name: Income of 2nd poorest 20%
description: Percentage share of income or consumption is the share that accrues to subgroups of population indicated by deciles or quintiles. Percentage shares by quintile may not sum to 100 because of rounding.

name: Income of poorest 20%
description: Percentage share of income or consumption is the share that accrues to subgroups of population indicated by deciles or quintiles. Percentage shares by quintile may not sum to 100 because of rounding.

name: Income of poorest 10%
description: Percentage share of income or consumption is the share that accrues to subgroups of population indicated by deciles or quintiles. Percentage shares by quintile may not sum to 100 because of rounding.

name: Inflation
description: Inflation as measured by the annual growth rate of the GDP implicit deflator shows the rate of price change in the economy as a whole. The GDP implicit deflator is the ratio of GDP in current local currency to GDP in constant local currency.

name: Central bank discount rate
description: Central bank discount rate (annual %)

name: Investments
description: Outlays on additions to the fixed assets of the economy plus net changes in the level of inventories. Fixed assets include land improvements (fences, ditches, drains, and so on); plant, machinery, and equipment purchases; and the construction of roads, railways, and the like, including schools, offices, hospitals, private residential dwellings, and commercial and industrial buildings. Inventories are stocks of goods held by firms to meet temporary or unexpected fluctuations in production or sales, and "work in progress".

name: Tax revenue
description: Tax revenue refers to compulsory transfers to the central government for public purposes. Certain compulsory transfers such as fines, penalties, and most social security contributions are excluded. Refunds and corrections of erroneously collected tax revenue are treated as negative revenue.

name: Foreign investment inflows
description: Net inflows of investment to acquire a lasting management interest (10 percent or more of voting stock) in an enterprise operating in an economy other than that of the investor. It is the sum of equity capital, reinvestment of earnings, other long-term capital, and short-term capital as shown in the balance of payments, as a percentage of GDP.

name: Foreign investment outflows
description: Net outflows of investment to acquire a lasting management interest (10 percent or more of voting stock) in an enterprise operating in an economy other than that of the investor. It is the sum of equity capital, reinvestment of earnings, other long-term capital, and short-term capital as shown in the balance of payments, as a percentage of GDP.

name: Patent applications
description: Patents are documents issued by a government office that describe an invention and create a legal situation in which the patented invention can normally be exploited only by or with the authorization of the patent holder. The protection is generally limited to 20 years.

name: Patents granted
description: Patents are documents issued by a government office that describe an invention and create a legal situation in which the patented invention can normally be exploited only by or with the authorization of the patent holder. The protection is generally limited to 20 years.

name: Patents in force
description: Patents are documents issued by a government office that describe an invention and create a legal situation in which the patented invention can normally be exploited only by or with the authorization of the patent holder. The protection is generally limited to 20 years.

name: Poverty
description: The percentage of people living on less than $2 (2005 purchasing power parity dollars).

name: Rural poverty
description: Poverty headcount ratio at rural poverty line (% of rural population)

name: Urban poverty
description: Poverty headcount ratio at urban poverty line (% of urban population)

name: Extreme poverty
description: The percentage of people living on less than $1.25 (2005 purchasing power parity dollars).

name: Agriculture
description: Agriculture includes forestry, hunting, and fishing, as well as cultivation of crops and livestock production. Value added is the net output of a sector after adding up all outputs and subtracting intermediate inputs. It is calculated without making deductions for depreciation of fabricated assets or depletion and degradation of natural resources.

name: Industry
description: Industry comprises value added in mining, manufacturing (also reported as a separate subgroup), construction, electricity, water, and gas. Value added is the net output of a sector after adding up all outputs and subtracting intermediate inputs. It is calculated without making deductions for depreciation of fabricated assets or depletion and degradation of natural resources.

name: Services
description: Services include wholesale and retail trade (including hotels and restaurants), transport, and government, financial, professional, and personal services such as education, health care, and real estate services. Also included are imputed bank service charges, import duties, and any statistical discrepancies noted by national compilers as well as discrepancies arising from rescaling.

name: Exports
description: Exports of goods and services represent the value of all goods and other market services provided to the rest of the world. They include the value of merchandise, freight, insurance, transport, travel, royalties, license fees, and other services, such as communication, construction, financial, information, business, personal, and government services. They exclude labor and property income (formerly called factor services) as well as transfer payments.

name: Imports
description: Imports of goods and services represent the value of all goods and other market services received from the rest of the world. They include the value of merchandise, freight, insurance, transport, travel, royalties, license fees, and other services, such as communication, construction, financial, information, business, personal, and government services. They exclude labor and property income (formerly called factor services) as well as transfer payments.

name: Arms exports
description: Data for some countries are based on partial or uncertain data or rough estimates. Arms transfers cover the supply of military weapons through sales, aid, gifts, and those made through manufacturing licenses. Data cover major conventional weapons such as aircraft, armored vehicles, artillery, radar systems, missiles, and ships designed for military use. Excluded are transfers of other military equipment such as small arms and light weapons, trucks, small artillery, ammunition, support equipment, technology transfers, and other services. In 1990 prices.

name: Arms imports
description: Data for some countries are based on partial or uncertain data or rough estimates. Arms transfers cover the supply of military weapons through sales, aid, gifts, and those made through manufacturing licenses. Data cover major conventional weapons such as aircraft, armored vehicles, artillery, radar systems, missiles, and ships designed for military use. Excluded are transfers of other military equipment such as small arms and light weapons, trucks, small artillery, ammunition, support equipment, technology transfers, and other services.In 1990 prices,

name: Total GDP, PPP
description: PPP GDP is gross domestic product converted to international dollars using purchasing power parity rates. A PPP dollar has the same purchasing power over GDP as the U.S. dollar has in the United States. Data are in constant 2005 international dollars.

name: High-technology exports
description: High-technology exports are products with high R&D intensity, such as in aerospace, computers, pharmaceuticals, scientific instruments, and electrical machinery.

name: Merchandise trade
description: Merchandise trade as a share of GDP is the sum of merchandise exports and imports divided by the value of GDP, all in current U. S. dollars.

name: Trade balance
description: The value of exports of goods and services minus the value of imports of goods and services. Measured in US$.

name: Trade balance share of GDP
description: External balance on goods and services (formerly resource balance) equals exports of goods and services minus imports of goods and services (previously nonfactor services).

name: Hourly compensation
description: Amount of financial compensation for each non-working hour, counted by US$.

name: Working hours
description: Total amount of yearly working hours devided by 52 weeks.

name: Market value of listed companies
description: Market capitalization (also known as market value) is the share price times the number of shares outstanding. Listed domestic companies are the domestically incorporated companies listed on the country's stock exchanges at the end of the year. Listed companies does not include investment companies, mutual funds, or other collective investment vehicles.

name: Military expenditure
description: Data, from SIPRI, are derived from the NATO definition, which includes all current and capital expenditures on the armed forces, including peacekeeping forces; defense ministries and other government agencies engaged in defense projects; paramilitary forces, if these are judged to be trained and equipped for military operations; and military space activities.

name: Math achievement, 4th grade
description: Average score in the international TIMSS test for children in the 4th grade.

name: Math achievement, 8th grade
description: Average score in the international TIMSS test for childeren in the 8th grade.

name: Ratio girls/boys in school
description: Break in series between 1997 and 1998 due to change from International Standard Classification of Education (ISCED76) to ISCED97. Recent data are provisional. Ratio of girls to boys in primary and secondary education is the percentage of girls to boys enrolled at primary and secondary levels in public and private schools.

name: Ratio of young literate females to males
description: Ratio of young literate females to males is the percentage of females to males ages 15-24 who can, with understanding, read and write a short, simple statement on their everyday life.

name: Literacy of adult females
description: Adult literacy rate is the percentage of people ages 15 and above who can, with understanding, read and write a short, simple statement on their everyday life.

name: Literacy of adult males
description: Adult literacy rate is the percentage of people ages 15 and above who can, with understanding, read and write a short, simple statement on their everyday life.

name: Literacy of adults
description: Adult literacy rate is the percentage of people ages 15 and above who can, with understanding, read and write a short, simple statement on their everyday life.

name: Literacy of youth females
description: Youth literacy rate is the percentage of people ages 15-24 who can, with understanding, read and write a short, simple statement on their everyday life.

name: Literacy of youth males
description: Youth literacy rate is the percentage of people ages 15-24 who can, with understanding, read and write a short, simple statement on their everyday life.

name: Literacy of youth
description: Youth literacy rate is the percentage of people ages 15-24 who can, with understanding, read and write a short, simple statement on their everyday life.

name: Children out of primary school
description: Break in series between 1997 and 1998 due to change from International Standard Classification of Education (ISCED76) to ISCED97. Recent data are provisional. Children out of school are the number of primary-school-age children not enrolled in primary or secondary school.

name: Children out of primary school, female
description: Break in series between 1997 and 1998 due to change from International Standard Classification of Education (ISCED76) to ISCED97. Recent data are provisional. Children out of school are the number of primary-school-age children not enrolled in primary or secondary school.

name: Children out of primary school, male
description: Break in series between 1997 and 1998 due to change from International Standard Classification of Education (ISCED76) to ISCED97. Recent data are provisional. Children out of school are the number of primary-school-age children not enrolled in primary or secondary school.

name: Primary school completion
description: Primary completion rate is the percentage of students completing the last year of primary school. It is calculated by taking the total number of students in the last grade of primary school, minus the number of repeaters in that grade, divided by the total number of children of official graduation age.

name: Primary school completion: boys
description: Completion rate in primary schooling for boys (percent of boys).

name: Primary school completion: girls
description: Completion rate in primary schooling for girls (percent of girls).

name: Expenditure per student, primary
description: Break in series between 1997 and 1998 due to change from International Standard Classification of Education (ISCED76) to ISCED97. Recent data are provisional. Public expenditure per student is the public current spending on education divided by the total number of students by level, as a percentage of GDP per person. Public expenditure (current and capital) includes government spending on educational institutions (both public and private), education administration as well as subsidies for private entities (students/households and other privates entities).

name: Expenditure per student, secondary
description: Break in series between 1997 and 1998 due to change from International Standard Classification of Education (ISCED76) to ISCED97. Recent data are provisional. Public expenditure per student is the public current spending on education divided by the total number of students by level, as a percentage of GDP per person. Public expenditure (current and capital) includes government spending on educational institutions (both public and private), education administration as well as subsidies for private entities (students/households and other privates entities).

name: Expenditure per student, tertiary
description: Break in series between 1997 and 1998 due to change from International Standard Classification of Education (ISCED76) to ISCED97. Recent data are provisional. Public expenditure per student is the public current spending on education divided by the total number of students by level, as a percentage of GDP per person. Public expenditure (current and capital) includes government spending on educational institutions (both public and private), education administration as well as subsidies for private entities (students/households and other privates entities).

name: Mean years in school, women 25+
description: The average number of years of school attended by all people in the age and gender group specified, including primary, secondary and tertiary education.

name: Mean years in school, men 25+
description: The average number of years of school attended by all people in the age and gender group specified, including primary, secondary and tertiary education.

name: Mean years in school, women 25-34
description: The average number of years of school attended by all people in the age and gender group specified, including primary, secondary and tertiary education.

name: Mean years in school, men 25-34
description: The average number of years of school attended by all people in the age and gender group specified, including primary, secondary and tertiary education.

name: Mean years in school, women 15-44
description: The average number of years of school attended by all people in the age and gender group specified, including primary, secondary and tertiary education.

name: Mean years in school, women/men, 25-34
description: The ratio of female to male number of years in school, among 25- to 34-year-olds, including primary, secondary and tertiary education.

name: Energy use
description: Energy use refers to use of primary energy before transformation to other end-use fuels, which is equal to indigenous production plus imports and stock changes, minus exports and fuels supplied to ships and aircraft engaged in international transport, counted in tonnes of oil equivalent (toe).

name: Energy use per person
description: Energy use refers to use of primary energy before transformation to other end-use fuels, which is equal to indigenous production plus imports and stock changes, minus exports and fuels supplied to ships and aircraft engaged in international transport, counted in tonnes of oil equivalent (toe).

name: Energy production
description: Energy production refers to forms of primary energy--petroleum (crude oil, natural gas liquids, and oil from nonconventional sources), natural gas, solid fuels (coal, lignite, and other derived fuels), and combustible renewables and waste--and primary electricity, all converted into tonnes of oil equivalents, counted in tonnes of oil equivalent (toe).

name: Energy production per person
description: Energy production refers to forms of primary energy--petroleum (crude oil, natural gas liquids, and oil from nonconventional sources), natural gas, solid fuels (coal, lignite, and other derived fuels), and combustible renewables and waste--and primary electricity, all converted into tonnes of oil equivalents, calculated by dividing with the population of each country during the given year, counted in tonnes of oil equivalent (toe).

name: Pump price for gasoline
description: Fuel prices refer to the pump prices of the most widely sold grade of gasoline.

name: Coal consumption
description: Total amount of coal consumption (tonnes oil equivalent)

name: Coal consumption per person
description: Coal consumption per person (tonnes oil equivalent)

name: Electricity use per person
description: The amount of electricity consumed per person during the given year, counted in kilowatt-hours (kWh).

name: Electricity use
description: The total amount of electricity consumed during the given year, counted in kilowatt-hours (kWh).

name: Residential electricity use per person
description: The amount of residential electricity consumed per person during the given year, counted in kilowatt-hours (kWh).

name: Residential electricity use
description: The total amount of residential electricity consumed during the given year, counted in kilowatt-hours (kWh).

name: Electricity generation
description: Electricity generation (kilowatt-hours)

name: Electricity generation per person
description: Electricity generation per person (kilowatt-hours)

name: Hydro electricity production
description: The amount of hydro power generated during the given year, counted in tonnes of oil equivalent (toe).

name: Hydro electricity production per person
description: The amount of hydro power generated per person during the given year, counted in tonnes of oil equivalent (toe).

name: Nuclear electricity production
description: The amount of electricity produced by nuclear power plants in a given year, counted in tonnes of oil equivalent (toe).

name: Nuclear electricity production per person
description: The amount of electricity produced by nuclear power plants per person in a given year, counted in tonnes of oil equivalent (toe).

name: Natural gas production
description: Natural gas production (tonnes oil equivalent)

name: Natural gas production per person
description: Natural gas production per person (tonnes oil equivalent)

name: Natural gas proven reserves per person
description: Natural gas proven reserves per person (tonnes oil equivalent)

name: Natural gas proved reserves
description: Proven reserves of natural gas (tonnes oil equivalent)

name: Oil production per person
description: Crude oil production per person (tonnes oil equivalent)

name: Oil production
description: Total amount of crude oil production (tonnes oil equivalent)

name: Oil proven reserves per person
description: Oil proven reserves per person (tonnes oil equivalent)

name: Oil proved reserves
description: Proven reserves of oil (tonnes oil equivalent)

name: Oil consumption
description: Total amount of crude oil consumption (tonnes oil equivalent)

name: Oil consumption per person
description: Oil Consumption per capita (tonnes per year per person)

name: Drought deaths
description: Number of people killed in drought during the given year.

name: Earthquake deaths
description: Number of people killed in earthquake during the given year.

name: Epidemic deaths
description: Number of people killed in epidemic during the given year.

name: Extreme temperature deaths
description: Number of people killed in extreme temperature during the given year.

name: Flood deaths
description: Number of people killed in flood during the given year.

name: Storm deaths
description: Number of people killed in storm during the given year.

name: Tsunami deaths
description: Number of people killed in tsunami during the given year.

name: Plane crash deaths
description: Number of people killed in air accidents during the given year.

name: Drought affected
description: Total number of people getting affected, injured or killed in drought during the given year.

name: Earthquake affected
description: Total number of people getting affected, injured or killed in earthquake during the given year.

name: Epidemic affected
description: Total number of people getting affected, injured or killed in epidemic during the given year.

name: Extreme temperature affected
description: Total number of people getting affected, injured or killed in extreme temperature during the given year.

name: Flood affected
description: Total number of people getting affected, injured or killed in flood during the given year.

name: Storm affected
description: Total number of people getting affected, injured or killed in storm during the given year.

name: Tsunami affected
description: Total number of people getting affected, injured or killed in tsunami during the given year.

name: Plane crash affected
description: Total number of people getting affected, injured or killed in air accidents during the given year.

name: CO2 intensity of economic output
description: Measures the amount of CO2 (kg) emitted for every dollar of GDP (constant purchasing power parity-adjusted) produced.

name: Cumulative CO2 emissions
description: Total CO2 emissions from fossil fuel for the period between 1751 and the relevant year in metric tonnes.

name: Sulfur emissions per person
description: Sulfur emissions per person. Associated with acid rain. (Kilograms of sulfur per person and year).

name: CO2 emissions (2012 version)
description: Total carbon dioxide emissions from the burning of fossil fuels during the given year (1000 metric tonnes of CO2).

name: Sulfur emission
description: Total sulfur emissions per year. Associated with acid rain. 1000 tonnes of sulfur per year.

name: Forest total area
description: Total area of land (hectares) which is spanning more than 0.5 hectares with trees higher than 5 meters and a canopy cover of more than 10%, or trees able to reach these thresholds in situ. It does not include land that is predominantly under agricultural or urban land use.

name: Primary forest area
description: Total area of forest land (hectares) with native species, where there are no clearly visible indications of human activities and the ecological processes are not significantly disturbed.

name: Planted forest area
description: Total area of forest land (hectares) established through planting or seeding, basically of introduced species and in some cases native species.

name: Wood removal
description: The wood removed (volume of round wood over bark) for production of goods and services other than energy production (wood fuel), excluding felled trees left in the forest.

name: Forest coverage
description: Percentage of total land area that has been covered with forest during the given year; excluding other wooded land, which is spanning more than 0.5 hectares, with trees higher than 5 meters and a canopy cover of 5-10 percent, or trees able to reach these thresholds in situ, or with a combined cover of shrubs, bushes and trees above 10 percent.

name: Biomass stock in forest
description: Biomass stock refers to organic material both above-ground and below-ground, and both living and dead, e.g., trees, crops, grasses, tree litter, roots etc.; including the pool definition for above- and below-ground biomass in forest; other wooded land not included.

name: Private forest land
description: Percentage of forest land that is owned by individuals, families, private co-operatives, corporations, industries, private religious and educational institutions, pension or investment funds, and other private institutions.

name: Private other wooded land
description: Percentage of other wooded land that is owned by individuals, families, private co-operatives, corporations, industries, private religious and educational institutions, pension or investment funds, and other private institutions.

name: Forest products removal, total
description: Total annual value of forest products in current USD, including both wood and non-wood removal during that year.

name: Forest products removal, per ha
description: Total annual value of forest products in current USD per hectares, including both wood and non-wood removal during that year.

name: Agricultural land
description: Agricultural land refers to the share of land area that is arable, under permanent crops, and under permanent pastures. Includes land under temporary crops, temporary meadows for mowing or for pasture, land under market or kitchen gardens, and land temporarily fallow. It excludes land under trees grown for wood or timber.

name: Forest area
description: Forest area is land under natural or planted stands of trees, whether productive or not.

name: Surface area
description: A country's total area, including areas under inland bodies of water and some coastal waterways.

name: Renewable water
description: Actual quantity of renewable water resources per person per year in cubic meters. Renewable water resources refer to the average annual flow of rivers and recharge of groundwater generated from perecipitation, which corresponds to the maximum theoretical yearly amount of water actually available for a country at a given moment. and the resources shared with neighboring countries (geopolitical constraints) have been taken into account.

name: Internal renewable water
description: Quantity of internal renewable water resources per person per year in cubic meters. Internal Renewable Water Resources (IRWR): Long-term average annual flow of rivers and recharge of aquifers generated from endogenous precipitation. Double counting of surface water and groundwater resources is avoided by deducting the overlap from the sum of the surface water and groundwater resources.

name: Water withdrawal
description: Total annual quantity of freshwater withdrawn per person per year, counted in cubic meters. It includes renewable freshwater resources as well as potential over-abstraction of renewable groundwater or withdrawal of fossil groundwater and eventual use of desalinated water or treated wastewater. It does not include other categories of water use, such as for cooling of power plants, mining, recreation, navigation, fisheries, etc., which are sectors that are characterized by a very low net consumption rate.

name: Municipal water withdrawal
description: Volume of water withdrawal per person per year directly used by the population, counted in cubic meters. It includes renewable freshwater resources as well as potential over-abstraction of renewable groundwater or withdrawal of fossil groundwater and the potential use of desalinated water or treated wastewater. It is usually computed as the total water withdrawn by the public distribution network. It can include that part of the industries, which is connected to the municipal network. The ratio between the net consumption and the water withdrawn can vary from 5 to 15% in urban areas and from 10 to 50% in rural areas.

name: Agricultural water withdrawal share
description: Percentage of the total water withdrawal used in agriculture, including renewable freshwater resources as well as potential over-abstraction of renewable groundwater or withdrawal of fossil groundwater, use of agricultural drainage water, desalinated water and treated wastewater. It also includes water withdrawn for irrigation purposes and for livestock watering, although depending on the country this last category sometimes is included in municipal water withdrawal. As far as the water withdrawn for irrigation is concerned, the value far exceeds the consumptive use of irrigation because of water lost in its distribution from its source to the crops.

name: Industrial water withdrawal share
description: Percentage of the total water withdrawal used in industry, including renewable water resources as well as potential over-abstraction of renewable groundwater or withdrawal of fossil groundwater and potential use of desalinated water or treated wastewater. Usually, this sector refers to self-supplied industries not connected to any distribution network. The ratio between net consumption and withdrawal is estimated at less than 5%.

name: Municipal water withdrawal share
description: Percentage of the total water withdrawal directly used by the population, including renewable freshwater resources as well as potential over-abstraction of renewable groundwater or withdrawal of fossil groundwater and the potential use of desalinated water or treated wastewater. It is usually computed as the total water withdrawn by the public distribution network. It can include that part of the industries, which is connected to the municipal network. The ratio between the net consumption and the water withdrawn can vary from 5 to 15% in urban areas and from 10 to 50% in rural areas.

name: Desalinated water produced
description: Total quantity of the production of freshwater by desalination of brackish or saltwater (mostly for domestic purposes) during the given year, counted in billion cubic meters.

name: Total water withdrawal
description: Annual quantity of freshwater withdrawn for agricultural, industrial and municipal purposes, counted in billion cubic meters. It includes renewable freshwater resources as well as potential over-abstraction of renewable groundwater or withdrawal of fossil groundwater and eventual use of desalinated water or treated wastewater. It does not include other categories of water use, such as for cooling of power plants, mining, recreation, navigation, fisheries, etc., which are sectors that are characterized by a very low net consumption rate.

name: Infant mortality rate
description: Deaths of children during first year of life (per 1000 live births).

name: Underweight children
description: Percent of children under five who are more than two standard deviations below average weight for age.

name: All causes deaths in newborn

name: Total health spending
description: The sum of public and private health expenditure as a percentage of GDP.

name: Gov. share in health spending
description: Percentage of total health expenditure that has been paid by government entities, for example Ministry of Health and social security agencies.

name: Private share in health spending
description: Percentage of total health expenditure that has been paid by private entities, for example commercial insurance and out-of-pocket payments.

name: Out-of-pocket share in health spending
description: Proportion of total health expenditures that has been paid directly out-of-pocket by individuals.

name: Gov. health spending
description: Proportion of total government expenditure that has been expended in health.

name: Total health spending per person (intl. $)
description: The average health expenditure per person, expressed in international dollars using PPP (Purchasing Power Parity).

name: Gov. health spending per person (intl. $)
description: The average health expenditure per person that has been paid by government entities, expressed in international dollars using PPP (Purchasing Power Parity).

description: The average health expenditure per person, expressed in US dollars using the average exchange rate.

name: Gov. health spending per person (US$)

name: Medical Doctors

name: People living with HIV
description: The total number of persons in all ages that are estimated to be infected by HIV, including those without symptoms, those sick from AIDS and those healthy due to treatment of the HIV infection

name: Adults with HIV share
description: The estimated percentage of adults aged 15 to 49 years that are infected by HIV, including those without symptoms, those sick from AIDS and those healthy due to treatment of the HIV infection

name: Total newly HIV infected
description: The total number of persons in all ages that are estimated to be newly infected with HIV during the given year.

name: Adults newly HIV infected share
description: The estimated percentage of adults aged 15 to 49 years that are newly infected with HIV during the given year.

name: Annual HIV deaths
description: The total number of people that were estimated as died from HIV/AIDS during the given year.

name: ART coverage %
description: For people who have been diagnosed as CD4 count < 350 / mm3, how many (%) have access to ART treatment, estimation.

name: Malaria cases per 100 000
description: Number of malaria cases in every 100,000 residents during the given year.

name: Malaria deaths per 100 000
description: Number of malaria deaths in every 100,000 residents during the given year.

name: Malaria number of cases
description: Total number of malaria cases reported during the given year.

name: Malaria number of deaths
description: Total number of malaria deaths reported during the given year.

name: Births attended by skilled health staff
description: The percentage of deliveries attended by personnel (including doctors, nurses and midwives) trained to give the necessary supervision, care, and advice to women during pregnancy, labor, and the postpartum period; to conduct deliveries on their own; and to care for newborns.

name: Contraceptive use
description: Contraceptive prevalence rate is the percentage of women who are practicing, or whose sexual partners are practicing, any form of contraception. It is usually measured for married women ages 15-49 only.

name: Maternal mortality ratio
description: The number of maternal deaths divided by the number of live births in a given year, multiplied by 100,000. Maternal death is defined as the death of a women while pregnant or within the 42 days after termination of that pregnancy, regardless of the length and site of the pregnancy, from a cause related to or aggravated by the pregnancy.

name: Maternal deaths
description: Total number of maternal deaths in a given year. Maternal death is defined as the death of a women while pregnant or within the 42 days after termination of that pregnancy, regardless of the length and site of the pregnancy, from a cause related to or aggravated by the pregnancy.

name: Maternal deaths, lifetime risk
description: The chance of dying during pregnancy or within the 42 days after termination of that pregnancy in a lifetime, regardless of the length and site of the pregnancy, from a cause related to or aggravated by the pregnancy, the counting unit is per 1,000.

name: Stillbirths
description: The number of stillbirths per 1000 births (live births plus stillbirths).

name: Suicides
description: Mortality due to self-inflicted injury, per 100 000 standard population, age adjusted. This rate is calculated as if all countries had the same age composition of the population.

name: Malnutrition of children
description: The percentage of children under age 5 whose weight for age is more than two standard deviations below the median for the 2006 WHO international reference population.

name: Sugar per person
description: The quantity of food consumption of sugar and sweeteners (grams per person and day). NOTE: data for 2004 are based on a rough extrapolation by Gapminder.

name: Food supply
description: Calories measures the energy content of the food. The required intake varies, but it is normally in the range of 1500-3000 kilocalories per day. One banana contains approximatly 100 kilocalories.

name: Alcohol consumption per adult
description: Recorded plus estimated alcohol consumption, average adult (15+) per capita consumption in litres

name: Smoking adults
description: Percentage of both men and women (over age 15) that smoke. Note: only 2005 tobacco data is provided by WHOSIS. In order to compare with 2002 lung cancer data, 2005 tobacco data was copied into 2002, based on the assumption that people's habit of smoking won't significantly change during 3 years.

name: Smoking women
description: Percentage of women (over age 15) that smoke. Note: only 2005 tobacco data is provided by WHOSIS. In order to compare with 2002 lung cancer data, 2005 tobacco data was copied into 2002, based on the assumption that people's habit of smoking won't significantly change during 3 years.

name: Smoking men
description: Percentage of men (over age 15) that smoke. Note: only 2005 tobacco data is provided by WHOSIS. In order to compare with 2002 lung cancer data, 2005 tobacco data was copied into 2002, based on the assumption that people's habit of smoking won't significantly change during 3 years.

name: Improved sanitation, overall
description: The percentage of the total population with access to facilities that hygienically separate human excreta from human contact. Improved facilities include flush/pour flush toilets or latrines connected to a sewer, -septic tank, or -pit, ventilated improved pit latrines, pit latrines with a slab or platform of any material which covers the pit entirely, except for the drop hole and composting toilets/latrines. Unimproved facilities include public or shared facilities of an otherwise acceptable type, flush/pour-flush toilets or latrines which discharge directly into an open sewer or ditch, pit latrines without a slab, bucket latrines, hanging toilets or latrines which directly discharge in water bodies or in the open and the practice of open defecation in the bush, field or bodies or water.

name: Democracy score

name: Human Development Index
description: Human Development Index is an index used to rank countries by level of "human development". It contains three dimensions: health level, educational level and living standard.

description: Death of children under five years of age per 1,000 live births. Estimates and projections from the Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation, 1970-2015.

name: Old version (3) of Income per person
description: The version of Income per person used before 22 december 2008 (version 3). Gross Domestic Product per person by Purchasing Power Parities (in international dollars, fixed 1990 prices).

name: Old version (8) of Income per person
description: The version of Income per person used before 12 july 2010 (version 8). Gross Domestic Product per person by Purchasing Power Parities (in international dollars, fixed 2050 prices).

name: Alternative GDP/capita from PWT
description: Expressed in international $ (PPP) and adjusted for inflation (in 2000 prices). The indicator measures the same thing as "income per person", but the source is different: Penn World Tables 6.2.

name: Subsistence incomes per person
description: The same as "Income per person (GDP/capita, inflation-adjusted $)" (version 9), but expressed in subsistence incomes per person ratehr than international $ per person. One subsistence income is equal to $1.25 per day (i.e. the lower poverty line), or $456.24 per year. Hence, we divided incomes epr person with 456.25.

name: Alternative poverty
description: National poverty rate is the percentage of the population living below the national poverty line. National estimates are based on population-weighted subgroup estimates from household surveys. Poverty lines vary between countries and so rates are not comparable.

name: Data quality - Income per person
description: Rates the quality for each observation of "Income per person - revised". The ratings are 0 (data quality not known yet) and 5 (very bad). You can use this "indicator" as color together with income per person to highlight the roughest observations.

name: Data quality - Life expectancy
description: Rates the quality for each observation of "Life expectancy at birth": (1) Yearly data; (2) Trend data; (3) Yearly guesstimates; (4) Trend guesstimates. You can use this "indicator" together with "Life expectancy at birth" to highlight the roughest observations.

name: Data quality - Population
description: Rates the quality for each observation of "Population, total". The ratings are 1 (very good); 2 (good); 3 (fair); 4 (bad) and 5 (very bad). You can use this "indicator" together with total population to highlight the roughest observations.

name: Estimate or projection of child mortality
description: 1=estimate; 2=projection (quality indicator for "Under-five mortality from IHME")

name: Data quality - Children per woman
description: Rates the quality for each observation of "Children per woman". The ratings are 1 (very good); 2 (good); 3 (fair); 4 (bad) and 5 (very bad). You can use this "indicator" together with "Children per woman" to highlight the roughest observations.

name: Data method - Maternal mortality
description: Method used to estimate "Maternal mortality": 1-Registration; 2-Reg. but ill defined; 3-Sisterhood surveys; 4-Mortality surveys, 5-Sample reg.; 6-Census based estim.; 7-Other data; 8-No data, model used

name: Economic growth over past 10 yr
description: Average annual growth in GDP per capita over the past 10 years, i.e. the data for 1980 concerns the average growth 1970-80. The data is based on the PWT 6.2.

name: How far to the north
description: The latitude of the country. A positive value means that the country is to the north of the equator, if it is negative it is to the south.

name: Income per person
description: The same as "Income per person (GDP/capita, inflation-adjusted $)", with projections from IMF after 2007.

name: Life expectancy
description: The number of years a newborn child would live if current mortality patterns were to stay the same. Medium variant projections until 2050

name: Babies per woman
description: Total fertility rate. The number of children that would be born to each woman with prevailing age-specific fertility rates. Data after 2010 is based on the medium estimates from UN population division.

name: Total population
description: Total number of population of both sexes, data after 2010 is based on the medium estimates from UN population division.

name: Female population

name: Male population
description: Total number of male population, data after 2010 is based on the medium estimates from UN population division.

name: Population growth
description: Annual change of population in percentage, data after 2010 is based on the medium estimates from UN population division.

name: Year categorization 1820-2010
description: This "indicator" simply duplicates the years between 1820 and 2010. Use it to color the bubbles (by selecting this indicator under "color" in the top right-hand corner of the graph). This is useful when enabling "trails" for several countries. Use this one for long time series.

name: Year categorization 1950-
description: This "indicator" simply duplicates the years between 1950 and 2008. Use it to color the bubbles (by selecting this indicator under "color" in the top right-hand corner of the graph). This is useful when enabling "trails" for several countries.

description: Percent of children under five who are more than two standard deviations below average weight for age.

name: Maternal mortality (WHO)
description: The number of maternal deaths divided by the number of live births in a given year, multiplied by 100,000. Maternal death is defined as the death of a women while pregnant or within the 42 days after termination of that pregnancy, regardless of the length and site of the pregnancy, from a cause related to or aggravated by the pregnancy.

name: Battle deaths
description: Battle deaths, age-adjusted mortality per 100 000 standard population.

name: Armed forces total
description: Armed forces personnel are active duty military personnel, including paramilitary forces if the training, organization, equipment, and control suggest they may be used to support or replace regular military forces.

name: Armed forces share
description: Armed forces personnel are active duty military personnel, including paramilitary forces if the training, organization, equipment, and control suggest they may be used to support or replace regular military forces. Labor force comprises all people who meet the International Labour Organization's definition of the economically active population.

name: Murder total deaths
description: Total number of estimated deaths from interpersonal violence

name: Suicide
description: Total number of estimated deaths from self-inflicted injury

name: Traffic
description: Total number of estimated deaths from road traffic accidents

name: Debt servicing costs
description: The sum of principal and interest paid in foreign currency, goods or services on long-term debt, interest paid on short-term debt and repayments to the International Monetary Fund, as a percentage of net exports and income from abroad.

name: External debt, total
description: Total external debt is debt owed to nonresidents repayable in foreign currency, goods, or services. Total external debt is the sum of public, publicly guaranteed, and private nonguaranteed long-term debt, use of IMF credit, and short-term debt. Short-term debt includes all debt having an original maturity of one year or less and interest in arrears on long-term debt. Data are in current U. S. dollars. World Bank, Global Development Finance.

name: Present value of debt
description: Present value of debt is the sum of short-term external debt plus the discounted sum of total debt service payments due on public, publicly guaranteed, and private nonguaranteed long-term external debt over the life of existing loans. The GNI denominator is a three-year average.

name: Exports unit value
description: Export values are the current value of exports (f.o.b.) converted to U.S. dollars and expressed as a percentage of the average for the base period (2000). UNCTAD's export value indexes are reported for most economies. For selected economies for which UNCTAD does not publish data, the export value indexes are derived from export volume indexes (line 72) and corresponding unit value indexes of exports (line 74) in the IMF's International Financial Statistics.

name: Imports unit value
description: Import value indexes are the current value of imports (c.i.f.) converted to U.S. dollars and expressed as a percentage of the average for the base period (2000). UNCTAD's import value indexes are reported for most economies. For selected economies for which UNCTAD does not publish data, the import value indexes are derived from import volume indexes (line 73) and corresponding unit value indexes of imports (line 75) in the IMF's International Financial Statistics.

name: Net barter terms of trade
description: Net barter terms of trade is the percentage ratio of the export price index to the corresponding import price index measured relative to the base year 2000.

name: Dead kids per woman
description: How many children a woman has on average that dies before their 35th birthday. It is based on the Total fertilirty rate and age-specific mortality.

name: Surviving kids per woman
description: How many children a woman has on average that survives until their 35th birthday. It is based on the Total fertilirty rate and age-specific mortality.
